bullets.text: Fed biennial debit-card report offers a high-level read on U.S. card-payment volumes, fees, and network/issuer structure—useful for payments competition and consumer-cost analysis.
Fed seeks input on defining a limited-purpose “payment account” for clearing/settlement, signaling potential changes to access and plumbing of U.S. payment rails.
NY Fed’s Williams says November CPI was pushed down by technical factors, implying underlying inflation may be firmer than the headline suggested.
Fed-governor Waller reportedly interviewed strongly for chair; leadership uncertainty can shift market expectations for the reaction function toward jobs vs inflation.
November existing-home sales remained weak as supply stalled, reinforcing a housing affordability/supply constraint that can keep shelter inflation sticky.
Data-center M&A hit a record $61B in 2025 amid AI buildout; investor sensitivity rises to OpenAI funding and utilization assumptions.
OpenAI is reportedly raising up to $100B at an $830B valuation—an indicator of capital intensity and scale economics driving the AI infrastructure cycle.
Delaware Supreme Court restores Musk’s ~$56B Tesla pay package, strengthening founder control and setting a major precedent for executive-compensation litigation.
Trump’s move to reclassify cannabis could broaden legal access and reshape financing; sector upside depends on banking, tax, and enforcement follow-through.
Nine large pharma companies’ drug-pricing deals with Trump intensify U.S. pricing pressure; European Big Pharma’s U.S. revenue exposure heightens earnings risk.
U.S. strikes on Islamic State targets in Syria signal continued counterterror operations, with potential spillovers to regional stability and U.S. force posture.
Trump names a new SOUTHCOM leader as pressure on Venezuela grows, highlighting heightened U.S. attention to sanctions, migration, and regional security.
NOAA deploys AI-driven global weather models, improving forecast skill and potentially reducing climate-risk uncertainty for energy markets, insurers, and disaster planning.
Researchers link functional “junk DNA” regions to Alzheimer’s biology, expanding therapeutic targets beyond protein-coding genes and reshaping genetic risk interpretation.
Security researchers warn of a Chinese hacking campaign exploiting Cisco devices, underscoring persistent infrastructure risk and the need for rapid patching at scale.
